channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Where Gaza protest voters stand ahead of Election Day
item.dc:creator: Clay Masters

item.title: Israeli strike on Gaza mosque kills 19 as conflict widens in Lebanon
item.description: As the expanding Mideast war nears a one-year milestone, Israel launched targeted strikes in Lebanon overnight, where the conflict pushed further north.
item.content:encoded:
As the expanding Mideast war nears a one-year milestone, Israel launched targeted strikes in Lebanon overnight, where the conflict pushed further north.

(Image credit: Anwar Amro/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: A strike on a mosque kills 19 as Israel bombards northern Gaza and southern Beirut
item.description: An Israeli airstrike hit a mosque in central Gaza early Sunday. Israeli planes also lit up the skyline across the southern suburbs of Beirut, striking what the military said were Hezbollah targets.
item.content:encoded:
An Israeli airstrike hit a mosque in central Gaza early Sunday. Israeli planes also lit up the skyline across the southern suburbs of Beirut, striking what the military said were Hezbollah targets.

(Image credit: Abdel Kareem Hana)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Pope names 21 new cardinals, increasing pool who will one day elect his successor
item.description: Pope Francis named 21 new cardinals Sunday, significantly increasing the size of the College of Cardinals who will one day elect his successor.
item.content:encoded:
Pope Francis named 21 new cardinals Sunday, significantly increasing the size of the College of Cardinals who will one day elect his successor.

(Image credit: Andrew Medichini/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 'I’m so grateful to these people.' Latino workers in storm-hit Tennessee feel isolated but hopeful
item.description: There are barriers preventing many Latino farm workers in northeastern Tennessee from trying to get help, but the extended Latino community is bringing the help to them.
item.content:encoded:
There are barriers preventing many Latino farm workers in northeastern Tennessee from trying to get help, but the extended Latino community is bringing the help to them.

(Image credit: George Walker IV)
item.dc:creator: Marisa Peñaloza

item.title: Margaret Atwood was advised to just find a good man. Her response: 'You're an idiot'
item.description: Margaret Atwood knows that she scares people. She opens up about that perception and also reflects on the bad advice she's received in her career and how she takes vengeance.
item.content:encoded:
Margaret Atwood knows that she scares people. She opens up about that perception and also reflects on the bad advice she's received in her career and how she takes vengeance.

(Image credit: Mike Coppola)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Martin

item.title: In Queens, N.Y., an immigrant street vendor is forced to confront crippling shyness
item.description: New York is known for its street food vendors. NPR spent time with a recently arrived migrant who is hitting the streets to sell for the first time, but has to overcome a huge hurdle: his shyness.
item.content:encoded:
New York is known for its street food vendors. NPR spent time with a recently arrived migrant who is hitting the streets to sell for the first time, but has to overcome a huge hurdle: his shyness.

(Image credit: Wendy Correa for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Garsd

item.title: Israel expands its bombardment in Lebanon as thousands flee widening war
item.description: Powerful new explosions rocked Beirut's southern suburbs late Saturday as Israel expanded its bombardment in Lebanon, also striking a Palestinian refugee camp deep in the north for the first time.
item.content:encoded:
Powerful new explosions rocked Beirut's southern suburbs late Saturday as Israel expanded its bombardment in Lebanon, also striking a Palestinian refugee camp deep in the north for the first time.

(Image credit: Hussein Malla/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump returns to rally crowd in Butler, Pa., site of July assassination attempt
item.description: The former President spoke at a campaign rally in the same location that a bullet grazed his ear in July. The shooter killed a man and injured two other people.
item.content:encoded:
The former President spoke at a campaign rally in the same location that a bullet grazed his ear in July. The shooter killed a man and injured two other people.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Hurricane Milton projected to reach Category 4 strength before landfall in Florida
item.description: Hurricane Milton is expected to reach maximum wind speeds of 145 miles per hour. The National Hurricane Center urged Florida residents to complete storm preparations and seek safety before Wednesday.
item.content:encoded:
Hurricane Milton is expected to reach maximum wind speeds of 145 miles per hour. The National Hurricane Center urged Florida residents to complete storm preparations and seek safety before Wednesday.

(Image credit: Gregg Newton)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim
